{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 25-year-old man with painless swelling of the neck and a history of HIV infection. On physical examination, multiple non-tender lymph nodes are palpable in the anterior and posterior triangles of the neck bilaterally. No other lymphadenopathy is noted. Laboratory studies show a normal leukocyte count and platelet count. The histopathologic analysis of an excisional biopsy of one of the cervical lymph nodes is shown in the image. Given the patient's history of HIV infection and the histopathologic findings, the most likely diagnosis is HIV lymphadenopathy.", "answer_choice": "C"}
